official-title.#text:
To establish the Manhattan Project National

		  Washington, and for other purposes.

designation of a Manhattan Project National

The purposes of this Act are—

to improve public understanding of the
			 Manhattan Project and the legacy of the Manhattan Project through
			 interpretation of the historic resources associated with the Manhattan
			 Project;

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: ; and

text.#text:
to enhance public access to the Historical
			 Park consistent with protection of public safety, national security, and other
			 aspects of the mission of the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
,
			 Historical Park communities, historical societies, and other interested
			 organizations and individuals in efforts to preserve and protect the
			 historically significant resources associated with the Manhattan
			 Project.

The Historical Park shall consist of facilities and
			 areas listed under

quote.#text:
Manhattan Project
			 National Historical Park Sites

text.#text:
The Historical Park may
			 only be comprised of one or more of the following areas, or portions of the
			 areas, as generally depicted in the map titled
Facilities, land, or interests in land that are—

at Buildings
			 9204–3 and 9731 at the Y–12 National Security Complex;

at the X–10
			 Graphite Reactor at the Oak Ridge National Laboratory;

at the K–25
			 Building site at the East Tennessee Technology Park; and

at the former
			 Guest House located at 210 East Madison Road.
Facilities, land, or interests in land that are—

in the Los Alamos
			 Scientific Laboratory National Historic Landmark District, or any addition to
			 the Landmark District proposed in the National Historic Landmark Nomination—Los
			 Alamos Scientific Laboratory (LASL) NHL District (Working Draft of NHL
			 Revision), Los Alamos National Laboratory document LA–UR 12–00387 (January 26,
			 2012);

at the former East
			 Cafeteria located at 1670 Nectar Street; and

at the former
			 dormitory located at 1725 17th Street.

Facilities, land, or interests in land that
			 are—

the B Reactor
			 National Historic Landmark;

the White Bluffs
			 Bank building in the White Bluffs Historic District;

the warehouse at
			 the Bruggemann’s Agricultural Complex;

the Hanford
			 Irrigation District Pump House; and

the T Plant (221–T
			 Process Building).

No non-Federal property may be included in the
			 Historical Park without the written consent of the owner.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:

text.#text:
For the purposes of this Act, or for the
			 purpose of preserving and providing access to historically significant
			 Manhattan Project resources, the

Nothing in this Act, the establishment of the Historical
			 Park, or the management plan for the Historical Park shall be construed to
			 create buffer zones outside of the Historical Park. That an activity can be
			 seen and heard from within the Historical Park shall not preclude the conduct
			 of that activity or use outside the Historical Park.

Nothing in this Act shall constitute a cause of action
			 with respect to activities outside or adjacent to the established boundary of
			 the Historical Park.
